learning_objectives: the necessity of an operating system
the function of an operating system

items.definition: Any physical component of a computer system with a definite shape.
The booting instructions stored in the ROM (Read Only Memory).
A set of instructions given to the computer to perform some activity.

content.title: Initial Operations / Booting
steps: The user powers up the computer, CPU activates BIOS.
POST (Power On Self-Test) runs using CMOS to check hardware.
Reads MBR (Master Boot Record) in boot drive.
Loads Operating System in boot drive to RAM (Main Memory).
Operating System takes control and displays user interface.

content.description: System software is divided into three types.
content.details: The Operating System provides for the user to utilize the functions of a computer by managing the hardware and software in it.

content.title: a. Operating System
content.description: Provides instructions for installation and management of various application software. Manages all input, output and computer memory.

content.title: b. Utility Software
content.description: Used to manage and analyze the software in the computer. Helps in managing resources.

content.title: c. Language Translators
content.description: Translates high level languages to machine language.

types.name: Compiler
types.function: Translates entire program to machine code.

content.text: Runs on the Operating System to carry out computer based activities of the user.

The software which facilitates the interaction between human user and hardware is the Operating System. It manages all the input, output and computer memory. It is the sole software which manages the whole computer system.

content.name: Single user
content.description: Provides service to one person at a time.

content.name: Multi-user
content.description: Allows multiple users to use a system simultaneously.

content.name: Multi-tasking
content.description: Allows to run multiple processes at the same time.

content.name: Real Time
content.description: Gives the output in real time without observable delays.

content.text: The Operating System is a software which manages the hardware and other software. It provides services to other software. Two main services: Managing hardware and Providing user interface.

content.title: 1. Managing the Hardware of a computer

content.name: i. Process Management
content.details: Allocation of CPU time, allocation of memory, allocation of input output devices of each process. Prioritization of processes.
content.example: Printing a letter (single process vs multiple tasks).

content.name: ii. Memory Management
content.details: Ensuring enough memory is allocated for each process and freed once the process ends. Utilizing Primary Memory (RAM) and Secondary Memory efficiently.
content.example: Typing changes to a document while it is printing.

content.name: iii. Device Management
content.details: Responsible for managing peripheral devices. Device controllers manage devices, device drivers manage software components.
content.example: Installing a printer driver. Plug and play devices.

content.name: iv. File Management
content.details: Saving data in files and keeping them in folders. Services: Making/deleting files/folders, Renaming, Changing storage location, Creating backups.
content.note: Includes handling file properties, operations, access and file systems.

content.name: v. Security Management
content.details: Protecting from malicious software (Viruses) and unauthorized access.
content.note: Uses external (third party) software support as well.

content.name: vi. Network Management
content.details: Supports different types of network connectivity (wired and wireless). Helps in accessing computer from remote computer. Facilitates Cloud Computing.

content.name: Command Line Interface - CLI
content.description: Had a 'prompt' where commands are keyed in using a keyboard. Correct syntax must be used.

content.name: Graphical User Interface - GUI
content.description: Uses graphics on their interfaces (Mouse, Finger tips).

content.definition: Process of dividing an individual drive into multiple logical drives.
reasons: To save different items in different places.
To have more than one Operating System on the same machine.
To meet the requirement of the Operating System.
content.process_note: Partitioning is performed at the time when a hard disk is configured for the first time. Re-partitioning deletes all data. Naming conventions differ in Windows (C:, D:) vs Linux (directories).

subjects.title: Disk Formatting
subjects.content: Preparing a data storage device for storing data using a file format. Data is deleted during formatting. USBs come pre-formatted.

content.problem: A single file may be stored in different parts of a disk (fragmentation), taking longer to read.
content.solution: Rearranging fragmented data so it will work more efficiently.
content.note: Linux based systems leave space between files to minimize fragmentation, so defragmentation utility is not needed.

content.title: File Name and Extension
content.description: File names consist of two components: file name and file extension. Extensions are hidden by default.

content.title: Finding out the File Extension
steps: Start -> Control Panel -> Folder Options -> View
Untick 'Hide Extensions for known File types'

content.title: Selecting a location to save a file
content.description: Location is called a drive. Partitions are named [C:], [D:], [E:] in Windows. Removable drives like CDs/Flash drives get subsequent letter names (e.g., [G:]).

actions.name: Deleting
actions.note: Deleted file/folder is placed in Recycle Bin temporarily.

sections.title: Summary
content: Operating System is essential for Operating a Computer.
All the Application Software in the computer runs on the Operating System.
The User Interface functions as a facilitator between the computer and the user.
The GUI is convenient to the user than the CLI.
The types of Operating System are: Single User, Multi User, Multi-tasking and Real Time User.
The Operating System which provides service to one person at a time is called a Single User Operating System.
The Operating System which allows multiple users to use a system is called a Multi User Operating System.
The Operating System which allows to run multiple process at the same time is called a Multi-Tasking Operating System.
The Operating System helps in managing all the resources of a computer.
The hard disk is partitioned and formatted before installing an Operating System.
A file consists of a File Name and Extension.
Folders are used to save files.
In order to save the files the user creates folders inside the drive.
